'''Caras Gaer''' was "a strange shrine"<ref>[https://bearmccreary.com/the-lord-of-the-rings-episode-202/ The Lord of the Rings: Episode 202], by [[Bear McCreary]], oct. 15, 2024.</ref> that acted as the [[Dark Wizard]]'s stronghold in western [[Rhûn]] in the late [[Second Age]]. Caras Gaer was invented for ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power]]'' by [[Amazon Studios]]. It appeared in the second season of the series.

==History==
Caras Gaer served as the staging ground for the Dark Wizard's schemes in [[Middle-earth]]. From here he ordered the [[Gaudrim]] and [[Mystics]] to intercept and capture [[The Stranger]].

==Etymology==
''Caras Gaer'' consists of the [[Sindarin]] words ''caras'' ("a fort or dwelling surrounded by bulwarks")<ref>{{Cite web|articleurl=https://www.elfdict.com/wt/493123|articlename=Caras|author=Parf Edhellen: an elvish dictionary|accessed=21 October 2024}}</ref> and gaer ("awful, fearful").<ref>{{Cite web|articleurl=https://www.elfdict.com/wt/514655|articlename=Gaer|author=Parf Edhellen: an elvish dictionary|accessed=21 October 2024}}</ref>
